meanings.definition: Make someone liable or inclined to a specified attitude, action, or condition before it occurs.
meanings.sent1: Eating unhealthy food predisposes individuals to weight gain.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing sunscreen predisposes you to sunburn.
meanings.sent3: His love for adventure predisposes him to seek new experiences.
meanings.sent4: Her optimistic nature predisposes her to see the bright side of things.
meanings.sent5: Regular exercise predisposes the body to better health outcomes.

meanings.definition: Make someone more likely to suffer from a particular condition or disease.
meanings.sent1: Genetic factors can predispose individuals to certain illnesses.
meanings.sent2: Smoking predisposes people to respiratory problems.
meanings.sent3: Skipping meals predisposes him to feeling lightheaded.
meanings.sent4: Living in a polluted area predisposes residents to respiratory issues.
meanings.sent5: Lack of sleep predisposes the body to weakened immune function.
